channel.title: Solokey v2 :: book.rymcg.tech
channel.description: Set PIN You should set a device PIN for the solokey, so that it cannot be used if it is stolen. Identify the device name (/dev/hidrawX): [bash]: Run this on your workstation: fido2-token -L This probably shows the device as /dev/hidraw0: (stdout) /dev/hidraw0: ...... Set the PIN for the device (/dev/hidraw0): [bash]: Run this on your workstation: fido2-token -C /dev/hidraw0 Steps to update the Solokey (v2) Install solo2-cli Tip solo2-cli is only required if you need to update your device.
